title: Option to force run (or containers-run) to save even if {cmd} exits with non-0

labels.name: severity-wishlist
labels.description: feature request, or bugs that are very difficult to fix due to design issues

labels.name: cmd-run/rerun
labels.description: Issues about the favorite command of ReproPeople

body:
I am scripting use of `containers-run`. I know that the command I am to run might fail, and I do want the `run` to fail if it does. But I do want to save outputs (log file from bids-validator) regardless of the output status. ATM I do not see explicit option for that.  I am only instructed in the output to
```
[INFO   ] The command had a non-zero exit code. If this is expected, you can save the changes with 'datalad save -r -F .git/COMMIT_EDITMSG .'
```
But that is cumbersome for scripting -- `run` could have exited with non-0 for some other reason (wrong container specified etc), and I would need to parse log to figure out either it was the actual command of interest which has failed.
So it would be nice to have some `run` specific option, such as `--always-save` or alike which would save even when command fails.
